questions.question_text:

Which three pieces of information must be supplied to the IDE during this process? (Choose three.)

choices.E: The environment into which the changes will be deployed
choices.A: The username and password of the destination environment
choices.D: The data of the fields which are being deployed
choices.C: The metadata components that need to be deployed
choices.B: The related change set connection information

discussion.content: Contact is private because not linked to an account...

Answer is B because When sharing settings are set to Private, the record owner and users above the record owner in the role hierarchy can view the record. In the scenario described, the sales manager should be able to view the contact owned by the salesperson, as they are above the salesperson in the role hierarchy. If the sales manager is still unable to view the contact, there may be other sharing settings or sharing rules that are preventing access.
Grant Access Using Hierarchies cannot be unchecked for standard objects.

Selected Answer: B
Anser is B: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000385610&type=1

When a contact record is saved without an associated Account, the system treats it as though the sharing settings are Private. This means that only the contact owner and those with View All Data or Modify All Data can search for it using Global Search or Lookup Search.

Selected Answer: B
Contacts are considered private, and cannot be shared if they're not associated with an Account.

questions.question_text:
A sales manager cannot view a contact owned by a salesperson. The person is below the sales manager in the role hierarchy.
Why is the sales manager unable to view the contact?

choices.C: The contact has NOT been manually shared with the manager
choices.B: The contact is NOT linked to an account
choices.A: Contact sharing settings have Grant Access Using Hierarchies unchecked

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants to allow its customers to submit support requests across multiple channels.
In which two ways can this be accomplished with Salesforce? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The correct answers are B and C.

B. Offering a chat button on the company website can allow customers to submit support requests in real-time through chat sessions with customer service representatives.

C. Enabling Chatter Questions in the company's Customer Community allows customers to submit support requests through a Q&A format. This can help to reduce the workload of customer service representatives by allowing customers to answer each other's questions.

choices.D: Enable the Service Cloud Console app on the company website
choices.C: Enable Chatter Questions in the company's Customer Community
choices.A: Expose the case feeds option on the company's website
choices.B: Offer a Chat button on the company website

This can be done by setting up the revenue schedule to recognize the monthly installment amount and the duration of the billing period.

choices.C: Create a workflow rule on the product
choices.D: Create a custom fields on the product
choices.A: Create a default quantity schedule on the product

How should an administrator meet this requirement?

choices.A: Forecast amount for each opportunity stage
choices.D: Forecast amount for other representatives on their team
choices.B: Forecast amount for each forecast category
choices.C: Opportunities that make up each forecast amount

questions.question_text: Which two types of data can a sales representative access from the Forecasts tab when using Collaborative Forecasts? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
options A and B are the correct types of data that a sales representative can access from the Forecasts tab when using Collaborative Forecasts.

Option C is not a correct answer as it is not available from the Forecasts tab. However, sales representatives can view the opportunities that make up each forecast amount by using the Opportunity Splits feature.

Option D is also not a correct answer as sales representatives cannot view the forecast amount for other representatives on their team from the Forecasts tab. However, sales managers and other users with appropriate permissions can see this information from the Forecasts tab.
